# System setup

```         
# environment variable: PATH=c:\rtools<123>\usr\bin
```

# Git and GitHub

```         
git config --global user.name "<NAME>"
git config --global user.email "<EMAIL>"
```

If needed, generate an SSH key: RStudio \> Tools \> Git/SVN \> Create RSA Key...

Then give GitHub your SSH public key: GitHub \> SSH and GPG Keys \> New SSH key

Create a new repository on the command line

```         
echo "# <REPO>" >> README.md
git init
git add README.md
git commit -m "first commit"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin git@github.com:<OWNER>/<REPO>.git
git push -u origin main
```

...or push an existing repository from the command line

```         
git remote add origin git@github.com:<OWNER>/<REPO>.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main
```

```         
# git remote set-url origin git@github.com:<OWNER>/<REPO>.git
```

# Development workflow


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
RcppArmadillo::RcppArmadillo.package.skeleton(name = "anRpackage",
                                              path = ".",
                                              example_code = FALSE)
```
:::


# Compiled code


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Rcpp::compileAttributes(verbose = TRUE)
tools::package_native_routine_registration_skeleton(".", character_only = FALSE)
```
:::


# Object documentation


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
roxygen2::roxygenize()
```
:::


# Automated checking


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
usethis::use_github_action("check-standard")
usethis::use_github_action("test-coverage")
```
:::


# Python

-   <https://www.python.org/ftp/python/>

```
python-3.10.11-amd64.exe
```

Check box for "Add python.exe to PATH"

## Quarto

```         
pip install pyyaml jupyter

```
